citations.narrative:
The facility set up at a table at the Nashville Exotic Expo held the weekend of April 20-21. The facility brought a large
number of young bottle baby raccoons, bottle baby silver foxes, a 9 week old harlequin macaw, baby cockatiel, baby
Indian ring neck and a 4 week old ringtail lemur to the sale all day on Saturday (show time 9am-5pm). The facility stated
that they brought the animals as they needed to be bottle fed and were kept behind the sales table but photos given to the
inspector show that these animals were held up to be shown to the public. The licensee stated that they did not attend the
show on Sunday with the animals based on the Saturday event. The noisy, stressful, air-conditioned cool environment
plus the length of time at the show is not conducive to a healthy environment for newborn animals. Young and immature
animals do not have a fully functioning immune system needed to fight off disease and infection and are exposed to a
large number of people and other animals in a show environment. The facility shall ensure that young immature animals
are not exhibited for periods of time which would be detrimental to their health or well-being.
Correct by 5/1/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensees.
n

narrative:
2.131(c)(3) 
   
Handling of animals. 
The facility set up at a table at the Nashville Exotic Expo held the weekend of April 20-21. The facility brought a large 
number of young bottle baby raccoons, bottle baby silver foxes, a 9 week old harlequin macaw, baby cockatiel, baby 
Indian ring neck and a 4 week old ringtail lemur to the sale all day on Saturday (show time 9am-5pm). The facility stated 
that they brought the animals as they needed to be bottle fed and were kept behind the sales table but photos given to the 
inspector show that these animals were held up to be shown to the public. The licensee stated that they did not attend the 
show on Sunday with the animals based on the Saturday event. The noisy, stressful, air-conditioned cool environment 
plus the length of time at the show is not conducive to a healthy environment for newborn animals. Young and immature 
animals do not have a fully functioning immune system needed to fight off disease and infection and are exposed to a 
large number of people and other animals in a show environment. The facility shall ensure that young immature animals 
are not exhibited for periods of time which would be detrimental to their health or well-being.  
Correct by 5/1/24. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensees. 
 
 n

species.common: RED FOX (INCLUDES SILVER FOX & CROSS FOX)
